title: Tutorial
text: best way interact network instantiate object buyer class buyer$new().

title: Tutorial
text: Executing query : executing query, get api key ip address web dashboard create Buyer instance call query method buyer instance SQL query string print recieved query accuracy results.
code: source("sdk.r")  api_key <- "buyer_key" ip_addr <- "127.0.0.1"   buyer <- new_buyer(api_key, ip_addr)  # retrieve the query sub key query_key <- get_key(buyer) print(query_key)   # Initiate a query sql_query <- "select count(*) as numpeople from public.condition_era_death" result <- query(buyer, query_key, sql_query)  sql_query <- "select count(*) as people_per_condition from person" result <- query(buyer, query = sql_query)  print(result)

what: NOTE!! : Related to SQL querying rules
title: Tutorial
text: allowed: Group , selection count, sum/min/max/avg limited columns, raw columns group-columns, conditions allowed: join, selection columns arent group , arbitrary sum/min/max/avgs

title: Tutorial
code: print_query_history(buyer)   "+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+" "select count(*) as numpeople from public.condition_era_death" "list(list(\"numpeople\"), list(30297))" "Results of this query can be expected to be within: 0.01% of the true value with 95% probability" "+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+" "select count(*) as people_per_condition from person" "list(list(\"people_per_condition\"), list(2000000))" "Results of this query can be expected to be within: 0.0% of the true value with 95% probability"

title: Buyer class for interacting with the network — buyer-class
text: get_columns(query_key = NULL) Return table ddl columns get_key() Returns subkey interact network get_key_list() Return list sub keys current buyer print_query_history() Pretty print history queries accuracy results query(query_key = NULL, query = "") returns result accuracy query
